Job Description
Duration: 6 Months (Possibility going to Direct)

Description:

This position will be responsible for working with engineering, operations and fleet teams to manage Reliability projects in the railroad environment on locomotives and other systems with a goal of identifying trends/abnormalities in faults and other data that lead to early detection of trends.

Essential Responsibilities

§ Maintain project scorecards for tracking outcomes and implementation.

§ Maintain daily, weekly & Monthly reporting for fleet team and prepare ad hoc reports

§ Make presentations to other teams and management on projects.

§ Support and drive projects to enable condition-based maintenance in the service operation

§ Assist customer and shop / field teams in implementing projects, troubleshooting project issues by performing data mining, analysis and reporting.

§ Continuously embed discoveries/learning back into other business functions and project teams by data analysis.

Qualifications/Requirements

§ Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited college or university

§ Minimum of 3 years of data analysis experience preferably in an engineering, Production or Manufacturing environment.

§ Expert level Excel user (Graphs, Charts, V-Lookups, Pivot tables, etc.) with above average skills in MS Access, SQL and other commonly used data analysis tools.

§ Proficient in use of commonly used office software with aptitude to learn custom systems quickly.

§ Strong statistical & mathematical background with analytical and quantitative skills; familiarity with Six Sigma concepts and tools.

Desired Characteristics

§ Ability to communicate with all levels of internal and external organizations, including upper management

§ Ability to execute multiple projects simultaneously and work effectively in a cross-functional team

§ Ability to identify opportunities to improve processes and initiate change; demonstrated commitment for process improvement

§ Strong interpersonal, influence, and conflict resolution skills

§ 1st hand knowledge of railroad operations and maintenance practices

§ Six Sigma, Lean, or equivalent Quality Program certification.

§ Working knowledge of RR information systems and databases
